mods.abstract: Committed to JailTAKEN up on Red River in the Parish Avoyelles, and committed to the Jail of that Parish a few days since, and recommitted to the Jail of the Parish of Rapides by proper authority, a negro boy who says his name is JAKE, of black complexion, very stout built and about 5 feet 6 or 7 inches high, about years oldHe has a scar on his left temple, also a small one on his left foreheadHe syas he belongs to DrLaycock of Baton RougeThe same boy was lodged in the Jail of this Parish sometime last yearHe was brought to the Jail of this Parish on Monday last by the Sheriff of AvoyellesThere is a bill left with me by the said Sheriff of Avoyelles against the owner of said boy for breaking Jail, damages, &c., in Avoyelles of $65-69Now, therefore, the owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take said negro away or he will be dealt with according to lawS.DMAGEEJailorap29-tf.
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU LibrariesCopyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domainPermission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
